column1: It was really marvelous that the girls were able to work such a transformation in themselves in so short a time. In the few moments that had been left to them they had rearranged their hair
column2: brushed the dirt of the plowed field from their clothing and washed their faces and hands. It was really a jolly dinner
column4: for the good-natured guest kept them all laughing with his humorous stories and odd remarks. He was so much like his daughter Jane that they had no need to be reminded of the relationship."This has been a day of excitement
column5: hasn't it?" remarked one of the guardians to Miss Elting. "Buried treasure
column8: mysterious strangers. Gracious me! What are the Camp Girls coming to?""I don't know. Did Mr. McCarthy say what the surprise is that he has in store for the girls? I thought perhaps he might have said something about it during our absence on that automobile ride."
